Subject: Weekly deaths
Title: Weekly deaths
Description: Deaths by age (week ended)
Caveats:
(1) Weekly deaths data are based on Date of Death and differ from other deaths statistics based on date of registration. These data are provisional and subject to revision during the full process of producing death statistics.

(2) Totals are by Date of Death. Week ending Sunday.

(3) Weekly totals will differ from those in the death registrations time series as deaths are registered at the time of burial or cremation of the body.

(4) An average of 5% of Deaths are registered 2 weeks or more after Date of Death therefore weekly totals are expected to increase over time as Death Registrations are submitted and processed.

(5) Overseas addresses or where location could not be determined and records where the persons sex is missing or not in Male or Female have been excluded as these numbers are too low to publish a weekly total.

(6) The accuracy of any administrative data, which includes but is not limited to address information is subject to human error.

(7) The data provided has been collated to the best of our ability and may have a small variance to any alternative publications.

Caveats:
(1) Weekly deaths data are based on Date of Death and differ from other deaths statistics based on date of registration. These data are provisional and subject to revision during the full process of producing death statistics.

(2) Totals are by Date of Death. Week ending Sunday.

(3) Weekly totals will differ from those in the death registrations time series as deaths are registered at the time of burial or cremation of the body.

(4) An average of 5% of Deaths are registered 2 weeks or more after Date of Death therefore weekly totals are expected to increase over time as Death Registrations are submitted and processed.

(5) Overseas addresses or where location could not be determined and records where the persons sex is missing or not in Male or Female have been excluded as these numbers are too low to publish a weekly total.

(6) The accuracy of any administrative data, which includes but is not limited to address information is subject to human error.

(7) The data provided has been collated to the best of our ability and may have a small variance to any alternative publications.

Subject: Activity
Title: Broadband usage by region
Description: Daily Chorus broadband use by region
Caveats: Only includes traffic on the Chorus network (excludes traffic for other local fibre companies, cable and fixed wireless networks). Regional traffic is based on the location where the traffic is handed over to the service provider. The sum of regional totals may not exactly match the daily national usage. Tasman encompasses the Tasman, Nelson and Marlborough regions. In some date instances across regions, data will not feature due to collection issues.

Subject: Travel
Title: Daily border crossings (by port) - arrivals
Description: Daily border crossings for all passports (by port) - arrivals
Caveats: Daily arrivals and departures data are based solely on border-crossings into and out of New Zealand, and do not incorporate arrival card information. These data are provisional and subject to revision during the full process of producing international travel statistics.

Subject: Travel
Title: Daily border crossings (by port) - departures
Description: Daily border crossings for all passports (by port) - departures
Caveats: Daily arrivals and departures data are based solely on border-crossings into and out of New Zealand, and do not incorporate arrival card information. These data are provisional and subject to revision during the full process of producing international travel statistics.

Subject: Activity
Title: New Zealand Regional Activity Indices (RAI)
Description: Regional Activity Index - monthly
Caveats: The Regional Activity Index (RAI) represents year-on-year activity growth for that region. A positive reading means that many of the underlying input indicators are growing at above-average rates, and vice versa for a negative reading. All RAI components are presented in terms of annual percentage changes, standardised to have mean = 0 and standard deviation = 1. As the benefit system has changed over time, the MSD jobseekers data contains modelled estimates of the number of claimants that would have been eligible under the current benefit system pre-2013. We reverse the sign of the RAI component for Jobseeker growth, so that these deviations move in the same direction as other economic variables (i.e. dips in a contraction). Consumer card spend is based on Paymark card expenditure. Electricity grid demand is sourced from the Electricity Authority's reconciled demand series. It has been allocated to each region using a concordance developed by Stats NZ.

Subject: Weekly deaths
Title: (Deaths) by region
Description: Weekly deaths data are based on Date of Death and differ from other deaths statistics based on date of registration. These data are provisional and subject to revision during the full process of producing death statistics. Totals are by Date of Death. Week ending Sunday. Weekly totals will differ from those in the death registrations time series as deaths are registered at the time of burial or cremation of the body. An average of 5% of Deaths are registered 2 weeks or more after Date of Death therefore weekly totals are expected to increase over time as Death Registrations are submitted and processed. Overseas addresses or where location could not be determined and records where the persons sex is missing or not in Male or Female have been excluded as these numbers are too low to publish a weekly total. The accuracy of any administrative data, which includes but is not limited to address information is subject to human error. The data provided has been collated to the best of our ability and may have a small variance to any alternative publications.

Subject: Household finances
Title: Ability to meet bills
Description: Respondents’ ability to meet bills and other financial commitments over next 3 months
Caveats: Wave 1 data collected over 14-28th April 2020. This mainly covers COVID-19 Alert Level 4 (except 28th April 2020 which was COVID-19 Alert Level 3). Wave 2 data collected between 30 September and 22 October 2020. This survey uses an opt-in quota sampling method, which is a type of non-probability sampling. As a result, there is some bias associated with the respondents of the survey. The findings reported cannot be applied to the overall NZ population.

Subject: Household finances
Title: Change in income
Description: Way in which respondents' household income has changed since beginning of March 2020
Caveats: Income refers to total monthly net household income from all sources. Wave 1 data collected over 14-28th April 2020. This mainly covers COVID-19 Alert Level 4 (except 28th April 2020 which was COVID-19 Alert Level 3). Wave 2 data collected between 30 September and 22 October 2020.  This survey uses an opt-in quota sampling method, which is a type of non-probability sampling. As a result, there is some bias associated with the respondents of the survey. The findings reported cannot be applied to the overall NZ population.
